request.description:
This API endpoint is used to retrieve a list of result types. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getResultType`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

### Response

The response has a status code of 200, indicating a successful response. The response body included the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "N",
            "resultTypeName": "Numeric",
            "resultTypeEId": "",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": true,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": false,
            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "T",
            "resultTypeName": "Text",
            "checked": false,
            "text": true,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": false,
            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "R",
            "resultTypeName": "Rich Text",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": true,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": false,
            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "D",
            "resultTypeName": "Date Picker",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": true,
            "expression": false,
            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "P",
            "resultTypeName": "Drop Down",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": true,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": false,
            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "O",
            "resultTypeName": "Total",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": true,
            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "M",
            "resultTypeName": "Multi-Select",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": false,
            "multiSelect": true,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,
            "formulaFlg": false,
            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "resultTypeCode": "E",
            "resultTypeName": "Decimal",
            "checked": false,
            "text": false,
            "richtext": false,
            "dropDown": false,
            "number": false,
            "datePicker": false,
            "expression": false,

            "link": false,

            "normFlg": false,

            "dropDown": false,

            "multiSelect": false,
            "decimal": false,
            "link": false,

            "normFlg": false,
            "resultTypeEId": ""
        }
    ],
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

`resultTypeCode` field holds the result type code

`resultTypeName` field holds the name of the result type

`resultTypeEId` field holds the unique ID of the result type

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the assessment scale types. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getAssessmentScaleType`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

### Response

The response received with status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "assessmentScaleTypeCode": "",
            "assessmentScaleTypeName": "",
            "assessmentScaleTypeEId": ""
        }
    ],
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

The `data` field in the response body is an array of objects, where each object represents an assessment scale type. Each assessment scale type object has the following properties:

- `assessmentScaleTypeCode`: The code of the assessment scale type.
- `assessmentScaleTypeName`: The name of the assessment scale type.
- `assessmentScaleTypeEId`: The ID for the assessment scale type.

This API endpoint is used to retrieve a list of assessment templates. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getReportType`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

### Response

The response has a status code of 200, indicating a successful response. The response body included the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "reportTypeDesc": "RichText_Template",
            "reportTypeEId": ""
        },
        {
            "reportTypeDesc": "Table_Template",
            "reportTypeEId": ""
        }
    ],
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

`reportTypeDesc` field holds the name of the assessment template type

`reportTypeEId` field holds the unique ID of the assessment template type

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the vitals of a patient. It is an HTTP GET request to the endpoint `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/patientVitals`.

#### Request

The request requires the `patientEId` parameter to be provided, which is the unique identifier of the patient.

#### Response

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "code": "703421000",
            "name": "Temperature",
            "measurementUnit": "oF",
            "measurementId": 258712004,
            "value": "69.00",
            "createdDate": 1699931923000,
            "createdBy": "7004032665",
            "visitVitalsEId": "",
            "eid": ""
       } 
    ],
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

The response body contains a JSON object with the following properties:

- `data`: An array of objects representing the vitals of the patient. Each object has the following properties:
    
    - `code`: The code associated with the vital.
    - `name`: The name of the vital.
        
    - `measurementUnit`: The unit of measurement for the vital.
    - `measurementId`: The ID of the measurement.
    - `value`: The value of the vital.
    - `createdDate`: The date the vital was created.
    - `createdBy`: The user who created the vital.
        
    - `visitVitalsId`: The ID of the visit vital.
    - `eid`:Unique ID of the Vital
        
- `errors`: Any errors that occurred during the execution of the request. In the last execution, no errors were reported.
- `status`: A boolean indicating the status of the request. In the last execution, the status was `true`, indicating a successful request.
- `errorCode`: An error code, if applicable. In the last execution, no error code was reported.
- `message`: A message associated with the request. In the last execution, no message was reported.
    

Please note that the specific values of the vitals and other properties may vary in each response.

This API endpoint is used to update the vital information of a patient. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to the following URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/updatePatientVitals`.

#### Request

The request should include the necessary parameters to update the patient's vital information. The response will contain information about the success or failure of the update operation.

``` json
{
  "updatedVitals": [
    {
      "eid": "s==",
      "code": "703421000",
      "value": 90,
      "visitEId": "",
      "measurementId": 258712004
    },
    {
      "eid": "s",
      "code": "271649006",
      "value": 120,
      "visitEId": "",
      "measurementId": 259018001
    },
  ]
}

 ```

#### Response

The response body contains the following JSON data:

```
{
    "data": null,
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the assessment scale types. It sends an HTTP POST request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/updateAssessmentStatus`.

### Request Payload

``` json
{
   "eid": "bjsdj",
   "active": false
}

 ```

`eid`\- the unique ID of the assessment

`active`\- 'false' to deactivate an assessment. 'true' to activate the assessment

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
{
   "data": null,
   "errors": null,
   "status": true,
   "errorCode": null,
   "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to retrieve all the assessment scales. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getAllScales`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint accepts optional request parameters

`deptEId` to get scales based on the departmentEId

`search` to search scales based on the search parameter passed

### Response

The response received with status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
`{
   "data": [
      {
         "eId": "mndnffn",
         "assessmentDesc": "Assessment Name",
         "createdBy": "admin",
         "createdTs": 1580923499000,
         "departmentEId": "djfndknfk",
         "deptName": "Admin",
         "active": true,
         "reportType": "Table_Template",
         "assessmentScaleTypeCd": "GENRL",
      }
   ],
   "errors": null,
   "status": true,
   "errorCode": null,
   "message": null
}`

 ```

The `data` field in the response body is an array of objects, where each object represents an assessment scale matching the search criteria. Each assessment object has the following properties:

- eId: The unique ID of the assessment
- assessmentDesc: The name of the assessment scale
- createdBy: The name of the user by whom the assessment is created
- createdTs: The timestamp at which the assessment is created
- departmentEId: Unique ID of the department to which the assessment belongs to
- deptName: Name of the department to which the assessment belongs to
- reportType: Template name of the assessment
- assessmentScaleTypeCd: assessment scale type code to which the assessment belongs to

This API endpoint is used to retrieve all the active assessment scales. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getAllActiveScales`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint accepts optional request parameters

`deptEId` to get scales based on the departmentEId

`search` to search scales based on the search parameter passed

### Response

The response received with status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
`{
   "data": [
      {
         "eid": "mndnffn",
         "assessmentDesc": "Assessment Name",
         "createdBy": "admin",
         "createdTs": 1580923499000,
         "departmentEId": "djfndknfk",
         "deptName": "Admin",
         "active": true,
         "reportType": "Table_Template",
         "assessmentScaleTypeCd": "GENRL",
      }
   ],
   "errors": null,
   "status": true,
   "errorCode": null,
   "message": null
}`

 ```

The `data` field in the response body is an array of objects, where each object represents an assessment scale matching the search criteria. Each assessment object has the following properties:

- eid: The unique ID of the assessment
- assessmentDesc: The name of the assessment scale
- createdBy: The name of the user by whom the assessment is created
- createdTs: The timestamp at which the assessment is created
- departmentEId: Unique ID of the department to which the assessment belongs to
- deptName: Name of the department to which the assessment belongs to
- reportType: Template name of the assessment
- assessmentScaleTypeCd: assessment scale type code to which the assessment belongs to

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the assessment scale items. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getScaleWithItems/{{eid}}`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint accepts {{eid}} as path parameter. `eid` is the unique ID of the assessment for which the scales items are to be fetched.

### Response

The response received with status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
 {
  "data": {
    "eid": "jvfnfnigir",
    "assessmentDesc": "General assessment",
    "createdBy": "admin",
    "createdTs": 1679573674000,
    "departmentEId": "asfnfjfsdfvn",
    "deptName": "General Surgery",
    "reportType": "Table_Template",
    "assessmentScaleTypeCd": "GENRL",
    "assessmentScaleTypeName": "General Assessment",
     "items": [
      {
        "resultTypeId": "sfdfsadcscgg",
        "resultTypeCode": "P",
        "resultTypeName": "Drop Down",
        "checked": false,
        "text": false,
        "richtext": false,
        "dropDown": true,
        "number": false,
        "datePicker": false,
        "expression": false,
        "multiSelect": false,
        "decimal": false,
        "link": false,
        "formulaFlg": false,
        "normFlg": false,
        "eid": "fsdfsdf",
        "displayTxt": "Are you deaf?",
        "createdBy": "admin",
        "createdTs": 1679573674000,
        "active": true,
        "dropDownOptions": [
          "Yes",
          "No"
        ],
        "dropDownList": [
          {
            "scaleItemMasterId": "sdfdsdf",
            "displayTxt": "Yes",
            "numericVal": null,
            "dependentScales": [],
            "dependentObjects": []
          },
          ],
            "subItems": [],
        "secondaryItems": [],
        "rowNo": 2,
        "columnNo": 1
      },
  "errors": null,
  "status": true,
  "errorCode": null,
  "message": null
}

 ```

The `data` field in the response body is an object. `data` contains `items`\- array of objects where each object represents an assessment scale item. Each assessment scale item has the following properties:

- resultTypeId: The result type unique ID of the scale item
- resultTypeCode: The result type code of the scale item
- resultTypeName: result type name of the scale item
- eid: The unique ID of the scale item
- displayTxt: Display text of the scale Item
- dropDownOptions: if the result type is drop down or ,multi-select, then it will contain list of string values.

This API endpoint is used to update a scale item. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/updateScaleItem`.

#### Request Payload:

``` json
{
   "eid": "vgvyy",
   "items": [
      {
         "resultTypeEId": "ncjdncn",
         "eid": "cdnjnvk",
         "displayTxt": "item 1",
         "referenceRange": "10 to 20",
         "defaultValue":"15",
         "minValue":"10",
         "maxValue":"20",
         "active": true,
         "subItems": [],
         "secondaryItems": [],
         "rowNo": 1,
         "columnNo": 1
      }
   ]
}

 ```

`eid` - Unique ID of the assessment for which the scale item has to be updated.

`items` array should have the assessment scale item object which has to be updated.

Following attributes of the item object can be updated: `resultTypeEId, displayTxt, referenceRange, defaultValue, minValue, maxValue, active, rowNo, columnNo`

#### Response:

The response will provide information about the success or failure of the update operation.

Here is an example response for a successful update operation:

``` json
{
   "data": null,
   "errors": null,
   "status": true,
   "errorCode": null,
   "message": "Assessment scale item updated successfully."
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to add more options to the drop down or multi-select result type scale items. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/addOptionForAssesmentResults`.

#### Request Payload:

``` json
{
"dropDownList":[{"displayTxt":"sample 4(4.0)"}],
"eId":"ndjbfjdnkdsn"
}

 ```

`eid` - Unique ID of the assessment scale item for which the options has to be added

`dropDownList` array should have the list of objects with `displayTxt` decribing the name of the option to be added.

#### Response:

The response will provide information about the success or failure of the add option operation.

`data=true` indicates response for a successful add option operation.

``` json
{
    "data": true,
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to remove options from the drop down or multi-select result type scale items. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/removeOptionFromAssessmentResults`.

#### Request Payload:

``` json
{
"dropDownList":[{"displayTxt":"sample 4(4.0)"}],
"eId":"ndjbfjdnkdsn"
}

 ```

`eid` - Unique ID of the assessment scale item for which the options has to be added

`dropDownList` array should have the list of objects with `displayTxt` decribing the name of the option to be removed.

#### Response:

The response will provide information about the success or failure of the removal operation.

`data=true` indicates response for a successful remove option operation.

``` json
{
    "data": true,
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the list of assessment scale. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getAssessmentScaleForDepartment/{{deptEId}}`

### Request Parameters

This endpoint accepts path parameters

`deptEId` to get scales based on the departmentEId

### Response

The response received with status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
`{
   "data": [
      {
         "eId": "mndnffn",
         "assessmentDesc": "Assessment Name",
         "createdBy": "admin",
         "createdTs": 1580923499000,
         "departmentEId": "djfndknfk",
         "deptName": "Admin",
         "active": true,
         "reportType": "Table_Template",
         "assessmentScaleTypeCd": "GENRL",
      }
   ],
   "errors": null,
   "status": true,
   "errorCode": null,
   "message": null
}`

 ```

The `data` field in the response body is an array of objects, where each object represents an assessment scale matching the search criteria. Each assessment object has the following properties:

- eId: The unique ID of the assessment
    
- assessmentDesc: The name of the assessment scale
    
- createdBy: The name of the user by whom the assessment is created
    
- createdTs: The timestamp at which the assessment is created
    
- departmentEId: Unique ID of the department to which the assessment belongs to
    
- deptName: Name of the department to which the assessment belongs to
    
- reportType: Template name of the assessment
    
- assessmentScaleTypeCd: assessment scale type code to which the assessment belongs to

This API endpoint is used to retrieve a list of departments. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getDepartment`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

### Response

The response has a status code of 200, indicating a successful response. The response body included the following data:

``` json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "deptName": "",
      "deptEId": ""
    }
  ],
  "errors": null,
  "status": true,
  "errorCode": null,
  "message": null
}

 ```

`deptName` field holds the name of the department

`deptEId` field holds the unique ID of the department

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the department of the logged in user. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getUserDepartment`.

### Request Parameters

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

### Response

The response has a status code of 200, indicating a successful response. The response body included the following data:

``` json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "deptName": "",
      "deptEId": ""
    }
  ],
  "errors": null,
  "status": true,
  "errorCode": null,
  "message": null
}

 ```

`deptName` field holds the name of the department

`deptEId` field holds the unique ID of the department

API to get the list of out-patients currently at the hospital

#### Request

The api accepts following request parameters

`patientname- String floorno-String visittype-"IN" or "OUT" checkInDateFilter-Date in YYYY-MM-DD format pageNo- integer starting with 0`

#### Response

``` json
{
    "totalResults": 119,
    "filteredResultCount": 67,
    "filteredresults": [
        {
            "checkInTime": 1699461417000,
            "visitType": "Out Patient",
            "visitEId": "",
            "billEId": "",
            "visitCode": "409",
            "patientCode": "CSOFTSUPPORT/113/2000",
            "patientName": "rome Some",
            "gender": "Male",
            "color": "#6945af",
            "birthDate": 507925800000,
            "patientEId": "",
            "wardEId": "",
            "visitDoctorEId": "",
            "ageCategoryCode": "Adult",
            "age": 13.0
        }
    ],
    "poStatus": null,
    "totalCost": null,
    "reviewerId": 0,
    "editFlg": false,
    "status": true,
    "storeName": null
}

 ```

Response returns the paginated result of currently checked-in patients with visit type 'OUT'. Response contains filteredresults- array of object with each object containing details about the patient.

This API endpoint is used to add an assessment to a patient. It sends an HTTP POST request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/createPatientAssessment`.

### Request Payload

``` json
{
"patientEId":"samlsamlmsa",
"assessmentEId":"ncdndnjdn",
"departmentEId":"cjncdncdsn",
"visitEId":"cdbjdsbcjdsbj"
}

 ```

`patientEId`\- patient Unique ID for whom the assessment has to be added

`visitEId`\- patient visit Unique ID to which the assessment has to be added

`departmentEId`\- the unique ID of th department for which the assessment belongs to. The value for this is obtained from getUserDepartment API mentioned above.

assessmentEId- the unique ID of the assessment that has to be added to a patient

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "patientAssessmentEId": "sasa",
        "visitEId": "",
        "patientEId": "",
        "staffEId": "",
        "assessmentEId": "",
        "departmentEId": "",
        "hospitalEId": ""
    },
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

Success response will have patientAssessmentEId in the response indicating the unique ID of the patient assessment that gets created.

This API endpoint is used to get the list of assessment scale items for an assessment added to the patient. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getPatientassessmentResulItemsById/{{patientAssessmentEId}}`.

### Request

The request accepts `patientAssessmentEId` as path parameter

`patientAssessmentEId`\- Unique ID of the patient assessment for which scale items has to be fetched.

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data with the list of assessment scale items of the patient assessment

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "1": [
            {
                "resultTypeCode": "S",
                "displayTxt": "Basic analysis",
                "active": true,
                "rowNo": 1,
                "columnNo": 1,
                "hospitalId": 0,
                "hospitalEId": "",
                "assessmentEId": "",
                "patientResultEId": "",
                "eid": ""
            }
        ],
        "2": [
            {
                "resultTypeCode": "P",
                "displayTxt": "Social smile",
                "active": true,
                "dropDownOptions": [
                    "Yes",
                    "No"
                ],
                "dropDownList": [
                    {
                        "scaleItemMasterId": 0,
                        "displayTxt": "Yes",
                        "numericVal": null,
                        "dependentScales": [],
                        "dependentObjects": [],
                        "scaleItemMasterEId": ""
                    },
                    {
                        "scaleItemMasterId": 0,
                        "displayTxt": "No",
                        "numericVal": null,
                        "dependentScales": [],
                        "dependentObjects": [],
                        "scaleItemMasterEId": ""
                    }
                ],
                "rowNo": 1,
                "columnNo": 1,
                "hospitalId": 0,
                "hospitalEId": "",
                "assessmentEId": "",
                "patientResultEId": "",
                "eid": ""
            }
        ]
    },
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to capture/update the result value for a patient assessment scale item. It sends an HTTP POST request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/updateAssessmentResultValue`.

### Request Payload

``` json
{
patientResultEId: "nsddbhdsbd",
resultValue:"samlpe",
eid:"bdjsabjadbda"
}

 ```

patientResultEId- Unique ID of the patient assessment scale result item for which the value is to be captured/updated.

resultValue- the value of the patient assessment scale result item. It is a String data type.

eid- the unique ID of the assessment scale item

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "rowNo": 2,
        "columnNo": 1,
        "hospitalEId": "",
        "resultValue": "samlpe",
        "patientResultEId": ""
    },
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to make the assessment status as completed for a patient assessment. It sends an HTTP POST request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/updatePatientAssessmentStatus`.

### Request Payload

``` json
{
"patientAssessmentEId":"ncjdjsdjdd",
"status":"1"
}

 ```

patientAssessmentEId- Unique ID of the patient assessment whose status has to be updated.

status=1 indicates the assessment is completed and no more edits are allowed.

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": 
        {
            "assessmentDesc": "",
            "createdBy": "",
            "createdTs": 1700005445000,
            "departmentName": "",
            "assessedTs": 1700005445000,
            "patientAssessmentEId": "",
            "visitEId": "",
            "patientEId": "",
            "assessmentEId": "",
            "departmentEId": "",
            "hospitalEId": "",
        }
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to get the list of assessments added to a patient. It sends an HTTP GET request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getPatientAssessment/{{visitEId}}`.

### Request

The request accepts visitEId as path parameter

`visitEId`\- patient visit Unique ID to which the assessment has to be added

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data with the list of assessment added to the patient for the visitEId passed.

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "assessmentDesc": "",
            "createdBy": "",
            "createdTs": 1700005445000,
            "departmentName": "",
            "assessedTs": 1700005445000,
            "patientAssessmentEId": "",
            "visitEId": "",
            "patientEId": "",
            "assessmentEId": "",
            "departmentEId": "",
            "hospitalEId": "",
        }
    ],
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

This API request is used to remove medication details associated with a patient. It is an HTTP POST request sent to the endpoint `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/removeMedicationDetails`.

#### Request

Pass the whole medication object which has to be removed as payload for this api as below.

``` json
{
  "medicationDetailsId": 0,
  "visitNote": null,
  "patientId": 0,
  "id": null,
  "drugId": null,
  "pharamProductRefId": 0,
  "drugName": null,
  "dosage": "",
  "brandName": "AZITHROMYCIN",
  "drugBrandName": "\nAZITHROMYCIN",
  "drugForm": null,
  "checkInTime": 1699461417000,
  "drugFormRefId": 0,
  "prescriptionflg": 1,
  "days": "2 days",
  "kmcRegNo": "0011",
  "frequency": "1-0-1",
  "frequencyRefId": null,
  "comments": "After food",
  "endTsNeedFlg": 0,
  "endDate": 1699554600000,
  "startedDate": 1699468200000,
  "visitId": 0,
  "doctorId": 0,
  "doctoruserId": 0,
  "doctorVisitId": null,
  "createdTs": 1699497046000,
  "active": null,
  "createdBy": "Roshan",
  "createdByUserFullName": null,
  "doctorCode": "0011",
  "hospitalId": 0,
  "dose": 0,
  "frequencyCode": null,
  "frequencyNo": 0,
  "feedVolumeMlPerKgValue": null,
  "feedIncreaseFrequencyNo": 0,
  "feedIncreaseDose": 0,
  "feedTypes": null,
  "feedRoutes": null,
  "routeCode": null,
  "infusionRate": 0,
  "maxInfusionRate": null,
  "medicationType": null,
  "careplanInstruction": null,
  "doseMeasureTxt": null,
  "doseMeasureId": null,
  "careplanInstructionId": 0,
  "concentration": 0,
  "flowRate": 0,
  "vialConc": 0,
  "correctionFact": 0,
  "allowedLowerLimit": null,
  "allowedUpperLimit": null,
  "reconfirmLowerLimit": null,
  "reconfirmUpperLimit": null,
  "allowDecimalFlg": null,
  "drugRule": [],
  "medicationDetailsEId": "",
  "patientEId": "",
  "visitEId": "",
  "visitNoteEId": "",
  "doctoruserEId": "",
  "doctorVisitEId": null,
  "doctorEId": ""
}

 ```

#### Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
       
    },
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": null
}

 ```

The response body contains a JSON object with the following properties:

- `data`: An object containing the details of the removed medication. The properties within this object include:
    - `medicationDetailsId`: The ID of the removed medication details.
    - `visitNote`: The visit note associated with the medication details.
    - `patientId`: The ID of the patient associated with the medication details.
    - `id`: The ID of the medication details.
    - `drugId`: The ID of the drug associated with the medication details.
    - `pharamProductRefId`: The reference ID of the pharmaceutical product associated with the medication details.
    - `drugName`: The name of the drug.
    - `dosage`: The dosage of the drug.
    - `brandName`: The brand name of the drug.
    - `drugBrandName`: The brand name of the drug.
    - `drugForm`: The form of the drug.
    - `checkInTime`: The check-in time for the medication details.
    - `drugFormRefId`: The reference ID of the drug form.
    - `prescriptionflg`: A flag indicating if a prescription is required for the medication.
    - `days`: The duration of the medication in days.
    - `kmcRegNo`: The KMC (Kangaroo Mother Care) registration number.
    - `frequency`: The frequency of the medication.
    - `frequencyRefId`: The reference ID of the medication frequency.
    - `comments`: Additional comments or instructions for the medication.
    - `endTsNeedFlg`: A flag indicating if an end timestamp is needed for the medication.
    - `endDate`: The end date of the medication.
    - `startedDate`: The start date of the medication.
    - `visitId`: The ID of the visit associated with the medication details.
    - `doctorId`: The ID of the doctor associated with the medication details.
    - `doctoruserId`: The user ID of the doctor associated with the medication details.
    - `doctorVisitId`: The ID of the doctor visit associated with the medication details.
    - `createdTs`: The timestamp of when the medication details were created.
    - `active`: A flag indicating if the medication details are active.
    - `createdBy`: The user who created the medication details.
    - `createdByUserFullName`: The full name of the user who created the medication details.
    - `doctorCode`: The code of the doctor associated with the medication details.
    - `hospitalId`: The ID of the hospital associated with the medication details.
    - `dose`: The dose of the medication.
    - `frequencyCode`: The code of the medication frequency.
    - `frequencyNo`: The frequency number of the medication.
    - `feedVolumeMlPerKgValue`: The volume of feed in milliliters per kilogram.
    - `feedIncreaseFrequencyNo`: The frequency number for increasing the feed.
    - `feedIncreaseDose`: The increased dose of the feed.
    - `feedTypes`: The types of feed.
    - `feedRoutes`: The routes for administering the feed.
    - `routeCode`: The code of the feed route.
    - `infusionRate`: The infusion rate of the medication.
    - `maxInfusionRate`: The maximum infusion rate of the medication.
    - `medicationType`: The type of medication.
    - `careplanInstruction`: The care plan instruction for the medication.
    - `doseMeasureTxt`: The text representation of the dose measurement.
    - `doseMeasureId`: The ID of the dose measurement.
    - `careplanInstructionId`: The ID of the care plan instruction.
    - `concentration`: The concentration of the medication.
    - `flowRate`: The flow rate of the medication.
    - `vialConc`: The concentration of the vial.
    - `correctionFact`: The correction factor for the medication.
    - `allowedLowerLimit`: The allowed lower limit for the medication.
    - `allowedUpperLimit`: The allowed upper limit for the medication.
    - `reconfirmLowerLimit`: The reconfirmation lower limit for the medication.
    - `reconfirmUpperLimit`: The reconfirmation upper limit for the medication.
    - `allowDecimalFlg`: A flag indicating if decimal values are allowed for the medication.
    - `drugRule`: An array of drug rules associated with the medication.
    - `medicationDetailsEId`: The external ID of the medication details.
    - `patientEId`: The external ID of the patient.
    - `visitEId`: The external ID of the visit.
    - `visitNoteEId`: The external ID of the visit note.
    - `doctoruserEId`: The external ID of the doctor user.
    - `doctorVisitEId`: The external ID of the doctor visit.
    - `doctorEId`: The external ID of the doctor.
- `errors`: Any errors that occurred during the execution of the request.
- `status`: A boolean indicating the status of the request. `true` indicates the medication removal is success.
    
- `errorCode`: The error code, if any.
- `message`: A message associated with the response.
    

Please note that the specific values of the properties may vary and are not included in this description for security and privacy reasons.

This API endpoint is used to save the patient assessment along with its result values as a summary to Progres TimeLine (PTL) of the patient's Visit. It sends an HTTP POST request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/saveAssessmentToProgressTimeline`.

### Request Payload

``` json
[
{"patientAssessmentEId":"bdjsabjadb",
"patientEId":"ndlndakn",
"visitEId":"nldnjfds"
}
]

 ```

patientAssessmentEId- Unique ID of the patient assessment whose summary has to be added to PTL.

### Response

The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data:

``` json
{
    "data": null,
    "errors": null,
    "status": true,
    "errorCode": null,
    "message": "Saved To ProgressTimeline"
}

 ```

This API endpoint is used to get list of Progres TimeLine (PTL) records of the patient's Visit. It sends an HTTP POST request to the specified URL: `{{baseUrl}}{{mobileAPIversion}}/getPatientProgressHistory`. ### Request Payload ``` json { "fromDate": null, "visitEId":"dsds==", "toDate": null } ``` visitEId- Unique ID of the patient visit whose PTL records are to be fetched. fromDate, toDate are date fields which accepts Date values. ### Response The response received with a status code of 200. The response body contained the following data: ``` json { "data": { "dateFilters": { "fromDate": 1630595469000, "toDate": 1699281221000, }, "progressHistory": [ { "type": "note", "progressNoteDesc": "

hello hai test ptl

", "createdBy": "admin", "createdByCode": "admin@thehealthscore.com", "createdTs": 1699250412000, "modifiedBy": null, "modifiedTs": null, "staffTypeCode": "AO", "detailEId": "gr5uNcSy+N42nHD68yfs5Q==", "visitEId": "kysxyOu7bvIIp2CliKrhxA==", "sourceEId": "fElhaw7OscR/L8y+7XeOyg==", "templateEId": "fElhaw7OscR/L8y+7XeOyg==", "activityEId": "fElhaw7OscR/L8y+7XeOyg==", } ] }, "errors": null, "status": true, "errorCode": null, "message": null } ```

This api returns the bearer token in the response that can be utilised as Authorization parameter for other API calls

the specified URL: `{{hsLoginBaseUrl}}/oauth/token?grant_type=password&username={{adminMobileNo}}&password={{mpin}}&hospCode={{hospitalCode}}&client_secret={{client_secret}}&client_id={{client_id}}`

``` json
{
    "access_token": "<token>",
    "token_type": "bearer",
    "expires_in": 2591999,
    "scope": "read write",
    "hospitalCode": "<hospitalCode>",
    "email": "email"
}

 ```
